intro: Barkeria cyclotella, commonly known as the golden star algae, is a unicellular, motile alga belonging to the class Bacillariophyceae. It is characterized by its distinctive golden-brown color and the presence of a silica-based cell wall, or frustule, which is often adorned with intricate patterns. This species is commonly found in freshwater environments, where it thrives in nutrient-rich conditions. Barkeria cyclotella plays a role in aquatic ecosystems as a primary producer and a food source for various microorganisms. Its rapid reproduction and adaptability make it an important indicator of water quality and environmental change.
